programme.title: CRAYFISH + KINA
programme.sub-title: S01 : E01 Piri’s Tiki Tour S1 - "CRAYFISH + KINA"
programme.desc: SYNOPSIS: In this episode, Piri Weepu heads to Tolaga Bay in search of crayfish and kina with the help of local, Richard Meihana. Piri gets a little local history from a kuia. Plus Piri and Richard pluck fresh water mussels from the river bed ahead of a whanau gathering.

programme.title: EELS + DEER HUNTING + BREAKING IN HORSES
programme.sub-title: S01 : E02 Piri’s Tiki Tour S1 - "EELS + DEER HUNTING + BREAKING IN HORSES"
programme.desc: In this episode, Piri is in Masterton to try his hand at eeling. Plus two Martinborough locals take Piri deer hunting and show him how to break in a horse.

programme.title: Brooklyn
programme.sub-title: S03 : E02 A Simple Path S3 - "Brooklyn"
programme.desc: Yann Horowitz skateboards with the KCDC skateboarding community in Brooklyn. Where he explores gaming, art and grilling with Crossy, Natalie, Jacob, Eddie and Nate, culminating in a joyful skate event showcasing community, inclusivity and fun.

programme.title: New Jersey
programme.sub-title: S03 : E03 A Simple Path S3 - "New Jersey"
programme.desc: Yann delves into New Jersey's skateboarding culture, meeting skateboarders who are into, fashion, horror, comedy, tattooing, and rug-making. He explores NJ Skate Shop and Freedom Skate Park, encountering Fred Gall and Brian Anderson.

programme.title: Impact Zone
programme.sub-title: S01 : E09 Chasing Monsters: El Nino S1 - "Impact Zone"
programme.desc: Francisco Porcella displays the unquenchable spirit that drives the desire to chase big waves.

programme.title: Lisbon
programme.sub-title: S01 : E07 Running the World S1 - "Lisbon"
programme.desc: Brothers Max & Benj Cave undertake a run where they attempt to escape from Lisbon castle without using any conventional exit routes.

programme.title: Barcelona
programme.sub-title: S01 : E02 Weekend Breaks with Gregg Wallace S1 - "Barcelona"
programme.desc: Gregg Wallace heads to Barcelona for a Weekend Break. Over the course of 3 days he tries incredible local food and drink and gets involved with local customs in a city where there always seems to be a party to join!

programme.title: New York
programme.sub-title: S01 : E02 The Streets S1 - "New York"
programme.desc: Rapper Shiniqua, aka Pretty Little Monster, juggles motherhood while trying to avoid the trappings of Instagram fame. Her passion is writing rap lyrics and always tries to keep it real.

programme.title: Kerala
programme.sub-title: S01 : E04 Journeys in India S1 - "Kerala"
programme.desc: Join us as we cruise the backwaters of Kerala, one of the most beautiful and serene areas of India. We explore the cities of Cochin and Kozhikode. Attend a local theatre performance and learn about traditional drama styles.

programme.title: The Far North: Amritsar, Shimla and Manali
programme.sub-title: S01 : E05 Journeys in India S1 - "The Far North: Amritsar, Shimla and Manali"
programme.desc: The Golden Temple is the centerpiece of the city of Amritsar, and probably the second most photographed building in India, but few know about the building or the people who built it.

programme.title: Agra and Its Environs
programme.sub-title: S01 : E06 Journeys in India S1 - "Agra and Its Environs"
programme.desc: Agra is home to India’s most recognizable monument—the Taj Mahal. We tour the Agra Fort and learn its role in the incredible history behind the Taj Mahal’s construction.

programme.title: Ecuador
programme.sub-title: S03 : E01 Traveling with Denella S3 - "Ecuador"
programme.desc: Denella treks through Ecuador visiting the equator and even swinging at the edge of the world with the tour operator, Exoticca.

programme.title: Galapagos
programme.sub-title: S03 : E02 Traveling with Denella S3 - "Galapagos"
programme.desc: Denella travels to The Galápagos Islands.

programme.title: Miami - Miamiland
programme.sub-title: S03 : E03 Traveling with Denella S3 - "Miami - Miamiland"
programme.desc: Denella travels to Miami or shall I say MIAMILAND. In this episode, Denella goes beyond the beaches to experience all that Miami has to offer on land.

programme.title: Mildura, Vienna, Hahndorf
programme.sub-title: S01 : E01 A Taste of Travel S1 - "Mildura, Vienna, Hahndorf"
programme.desc: Join Alana as she visits her home town of Mildura and then onto the beautiful Austrian capital Vienna. Scotty heads up north to the Western Australian pearl town of Broome and Skye explores the delicacies of Hahndorf, South Australia.

programme.title: Vienna, Broome, Barossa Valley
programme.sub-title: S01 : E02 A Taste of Travel S1 - "Vienna, Broome, Barossa Valley"
programme.desc: Alana visits the fresh food market in Vienna and Scotty tucks into one of Broome’s signature dishes. Skye’s in the historic town of Hahndorf and learns about its German heritage before visiting Australia’s premium wine region of the Barossa Valley.

programme.title: New South Wales, Budapest
programme.sub-title: S01 : E03 A Taste of Travel S1 - "New South Wales, Budapest"
programme.desc: Scotty visits the New South Wales south coast while Alana continues her European tour in Budapest while Skye tries her hand at golf in the world-renowned wine region of the Barossa Valley.

programme.title: Puerto Rico
programme.sub-title: S01 : E04 Luxe Travels S1 - "Puerto Rico"
programme.desc: Liesel explores all the hands-on activities such as riding horseback on the beach, riding ATV’s through the muddy swamps, and hiking through the super lush El Yunque rainforest. Luxurious resorts are only a stone's throw away - hopping islands, Liesel gets to experience the ultra modern and chic El Blok located in Vieques. Between stays at all the luxury boutique resorts, a common trend starts to appear, and that is the island’s cuisine.

programme.title: Hong Kong
programme.sub-title: S01 : E05 Luxe Travels S1 - "Hong Kong"
programme.desc: Hong Kong is Asia’s world city and this episode is a complete 360 from the melee of tropical island paradises. Hong Kong is famous for it’s skyscraper strewn skyline and in this episode, local girl Lesley Chiang is on a mission to show a different side of Hong Kong.

programme.title: Belize
programme.desc: Luxe Travels showcases beautiful Belize; with hundreds of kilometers of coastline with the Caribbean sea, the 2nd largest barrier reef, and one of the best dive sites in the world, how could you not? In this episode, Dani Kristo is on a mission to showcase the best of Belize

programme.title: Escape To The Rockies
programme.sub-title: S01 : E10 Big Little Footprints S1 - "Escape To The Rockies"
programme.desc: We travel to the UNESCO World Heritage-listed Canadian Rocky Mountains for their stunning natural beauty, historical castles, and epic adventures. This is a destination where protecting its natural resources comes before anything else.

programme.title: The Land of Rudyard Kipling: Kanha & Bandhavgarh National Parks
programme.sub-title: S01 : E07 Journeys in India S1 - "The Land of Rudyard Kipling: Kanha & Bandhavgarh National Parks"
programme.desc: With classic tales as The Jungle Book to his credit, Rudyard Kipling brought India to life for many readers around the world. In this episode, Bill steps back into Kipling’s wild world while exploring Kanha and Bandhavgarh National Parks.

programme.title: Bangalore and Ooty
programme.sub-title: S01 : E08 Journeys in India S1 - "Bangalore and Ooty"
programme.desc: Bangalore is a city with many names: the Garden City, the Pub City, the Fashion Capital the list goes on. Follow Bill as he journeys through this city of contrasts and touches on its many faces.

programme.title: Mumbai & Goa
programme.sub-title: S01 : E09 Journeys in India S1 - "Mumbai & Goa"
programme.desc: Join us as we explore the Gateway to India—Mumbai. From its early history, it’s many foreign occupations to the hustle and bustle of today. Bill tells Mumbai’s rich history is told through two of its most famous inhabitants, Gandhi and Kipling.

programme.title: Jamaica South Coast
programme.sub-title: S03 : E04 Traveling with Denella S3 - "Jamaica South Coast"
programme.desc: Denella Ri’chard ventures to the eclectic “off the beaten path” South Coast resort area, the cradle of Jamaica’s community-based tourism.

programme.title: Greater ft Lauderdale
programme.sub-title: S03 : E05 Traveling with Denella S3 - "Greater ft Lauderdale"
programme.desc: In this episode, Denella takes you on a stroll along Fort Lauderdale beach's famous Wave Wall and promenade.

programme.title: St. Thomas and St. Croix
programme.sub-title: S03 : E06 Traveling with Denella S3 - "St. Thomas and St. Croix"
programme.desc: Reconnect with paradise in the U.S. Virgin Islands as Denella explores the beautiful islands of St. Thomas & St. Croix.

programme.title: Danube River, Shellharbour
programme.sub-title: S01 : E04 A Taste of Travel S1 - "Danube River, Shellharbour"
programme.desc: Alana takes to the water on a Danube River cruise while Skye visits Henty Farm in the Barossa Valley and goes foraging with award winning chef Lockie Coleman and Scotty takes to the skies in Shellharbour in Illawarra region of New South Wales.

programme.title: Budapest, Barossa Valley
programme.sub-title: S01 : E05 A Taste of Travel S1 - "Budapest, Barossa Valley"
programme.desc: Alana joins executive chef ‘Primus’ on a visit to the Budapest Central Market while Skye discovers a gem in the Barossa Valley the historic 1856 estate, Kingsford Homestead.

programme.title: Coffs Harbour, Barossa Valley
programme.sub-title: S01 : E06 A Taste of Travel S1 - "Coffs Harbour, Barossa Valley"
programme.desc: Alana takes a bike ride in the beautiful Hungarian countryside while Scotty visits an impeccable pocket of paradise, Coffs Harbor. Skye discovers an incredible retreat called Appellation set amongst the vines in The Barossa Valley.

programme.title: Toledo Spain V Provo (Turks & Caicos)
programme.sub-title: S01 : E11 Jet Set S1 - "Toledo Spain V Provo (Turks & Caicos)"
programme.desc: Gill throws everything she’s got into this episode in her Spanish safari from the countryside town of Toledo, seventy kilometers south of Madrid. Richard visits the tiny island of Providenciales, part of the Turks and Caicos Islands in the Caribbean.

programme.title: Berlin
programme.sub-title: S01 : E03 Weekend Breaks with Gregg Wallace S1 - "Berlin"
programme.desc: Gregg heads to the German capital for a 3 day trip. He gets to the heart of Berlin’s food scene and gets involved in the beer culture. Between meals he explores the city’s often turbulent past and indulges his love of the musical Cabaret!

programme.title: Gir: The last refuge of the Lion
programme.sub-title: S01 : E10 Journeys in India S1 - "Gir: The last refuge of the Lion"
programme.desc: The desert of Gujarat is hardly the place one expects to encounter a lion, but in the scrub forest of the region Bill does exactly that. Join him as he tracks the lion and many less dangerous creatures from spotted deer to owls and parrots.

programme.title: Kathmandu and Chitwan National Park
programme.sub-title: S01 : E11 Journeys in India S1 - "Kathmandu and Chitwan National Park"
programme.desc: Just north of India is a land steeped in mystery—Nepal. Bill tours the city of Kathmandu, visits the World Heritage temple complexes, and walks along the city streets, where ancient and modern vie for space.

programme.title: Tamil Nadu: Chennai, Pondicherry and Much More
programme.sub-title: S01 : E12 Journeys in India S1 - "Tamil Nadu: Chennai, Pondicherry and Much More"
programme.desc: Chennai, formerly known as Madras, can trace its roots back to a tiny fishing village. Bill explores the city’s growth under the British East India Company, with visits to Fort St. George and the Fort Museum.

programme.title: Cyprus
programme.desc: Cyprus is the island of love beauty and in this episode of Luxe Travels, Host Sophie Ashley traverses the beautiful Mediterranean island to find out all about the must see and must experience spots in the birth place of Aphrodite!

programme.title: Rotterdam
programme.sub-title: S01 : E06 Street Art Challenge S1 - "Rotterdam"
programme.desc: Two European street artists are teaming up in the Netherlands for the ultimate Street Art Challenge but Mother Nature seems to be doing everything to ruin it.

programme.title: Miami
programme.desc: James Lance gets to grips with his Colombian roots while trying to build a career as a Latin hip hop artist. After raising himself as a teenager, he refuses to give up and dreams of a better future.

programme.title: Berlin
programme.sub-title: S01 : E03 Weekend Breaks with Gregg Wallace S1 - "Berlin"
programme.desc: Gregg heads to the German capital for a 3 day trip. He gets to the heart of Berlin’s food scene and gets involved in the beer culture. Between meals he explores the city’s often turbulent past and indulges his love of the musical Cabaret!

programme.title: Ibiza
programme.desc: DJ-producer Carly Foxx travels to the clubbing capital of the world to inspire her music track and discovers Ibiza’s alternative spiritual side.

programme.title: Europe
programme.desc: DJ and house music producer Carly Foxx looks back at her journey to the music dance capitals of Europe to inspire her final track.

programme.title: Vietnam - Heart of Hanoi part 2
programme.sub-title: S02 : E06 Maximum Foodie S2 - "Vietnam - Heart of Hanoi part 2"
programme.desc: Vietnam offers travelers a wide range of exotic as well as simple homegrown grub. Sashi rolls into town with no knowledge of Vietnamese cuisine, and he gets an indepth street food 101 tour of the city. From learning about haute Franco-Vietnamese cuisine with the city’s best French chefs, to a simple and honest bowl of pho. In this episode, Sashi uncovers the bustling city of Hanoi and all its trappings. Secret alleyways leading to decades old cafes offering famous brews like egg coffee; to iconic places that serve French style baguettes and everything in between!

programme.title: India - Mughlai Munchies
programme.sub-title: S02 : E07 Maximum Foodie S2 - "India - Mughlai Munchies"
programme.desc: It’s an incalculable undertaking to understand the cuisine of India; the depth of it is simply massive. Over the next 2 episodes, Sashi will explore the country from coast to coast, to understand how the cuisine changes as the kilometers rack up; This episode starts off with a rendezvous with Mumbai’s hottest chef, Prateek Sadhu. Sashi takes an inside look into how the city’s most popular restaurant, Masque does their signature 8 hands collaborative event. With Prateek and his star studded guest chefs, Matt Orlando from Copenhagen and Ivan Brehm from Nouri in Singapore; the trio head to Delhi for an ingredients scoring mission. From biodynamic farms in the outskirts to the old Delhi...

programme.title: The Valley of Desolation
programme.sub-title: S01 : E10 The Armchair Adventurer S1 - "The Valley of Desolation"
programme.desc: Xander and his team travel to Graaff-Reinet, one of the oldest towns in South Africa, to enjoy food, history, and nature, while Adam spends the day searching for fossils in his hometown.

programme.title: The Dullstroom Highlands
programme.sub-title: S01 : E11 The Armchair Adventurer S1 - "The Dullstroom Highlands"
programme.desc: Xander and his team drive eleven hours to Dullstroom, a quaint town where fishing and drinking prevails. Across the pond, Adam’s desire to participate with Xander and his crew takes him all the way to the grocery store.

programme.title: The Panorama
programme.sub-title: S01 : E12 The Armchair Adventurer S1 - "The Panorama"
programme.desc: On opposite sides of the world, Adam and a member of the South African crew each attempt to conquer their fears.

programme.title: Zagreb
programme.desc: Epic Exploring: Going Local visits Zagreb, Croatia. Cody fires a canon from the old tower, explores a never finished University Hospital and a political school.

programme.title: Barentsburg
programme.desc: Local Exploring on the edge of the world as Josh is on the artic Svalbard archipelago to explore in and around Barentsburg and the Arctic Ocean.

programme.title: Tirana
programme.desc: From Tirana, capital of old Soviet satellite Albania, Josh starts another local adventure filled with bunkers, a hidden hospital and diving in a pirate’s cave.

programme.title: Tying the Knot at 13,000ft
programme.sub-title: S01 : E01 Love On The Rocks S1 - "Tying the Knot at 13,000ft"
programme.desc: A Romantic trip to Colorado takes a windy turn when Jason pushes Tayler, despite her hesitation, to summit Mt. Democrat in 70 mph winds and -19 degree weather.

programme.title: A Newly-Wed Recipe for Disaster
programme.sub-title: S01 : E02 Love On The Rocks S1 - "A Newly-Wed Recipe for Disaster"
programme.desc: Jason loves mountain biking. Tayler prefers to read a book. Jason is up for any adventure tossed at him. Tayler likes to be a bit more prepared. Will the adventures that await in Arkansas leave the couple questioning if they have anything in common?

programme.title: Theodora's Room
programme.sub-title: S01 : E03 Love On The Rocks S1 - "Theodora's Room"
programme.desc: Tayler and Jason travel to Eureka Springs, AR, a town with a rich history and home to one of the most haunted hotels in America, The Crescent. Jason convinces Tayler to stay one night, but will that stay lead to a night they don't want to remember?

programme.title: Erg Chigagga, Sahara, Morocco
programme.sub-title: S01 : E09 Beyond The Beaten Path S1 - "Erg Chigagga, Sahara, Morocco"
programme.desc: From Marrakesh, the brothers take a series of local Berber taxis over the High Atlas Mountains and down into the Draa Valley until the road ends at the edge of the great sand sea of the Sahara where they bury some treasure.

programme.title: Arviat, Nunavut, Canada
programme.sub-title: S01 : E10 Beyond The Beaten Path S1 - "Arviat, Nunavut, Canada"
programme.desc: Heading to the far north into the Arctic to learn about the Inuit’s traditional culture and incredible way of life, the brothers accompany an elder and young hunter on a 200-mile skidoo hunt across the barren land and frozen sea ice.

programme.title: Kushtia, Bangladesh
programme.sub-title: S01 : E11 Beyond The Beaten Path S1 - "Kushtia, Bangladesh"
programme.desc: The brothers traverse the country’s interconnecting network of waterways by ferryboat. From shrimp baron, to peasant fishermen, lofty temple ruins to anonymous chai wallahs, they make their way to Kushtia, home to the shrine of Guru Lalone Shaw.

programme.title: Day 1
programme.desc: Kevin travels to Switzerland and has 24 hours to go from Zurich to the Swiss mountains, while Jalou finds an exciting way to go from Cannes to Corsica.

programme.title: Day 2
programme.desc: Jalou has 24 hours to get from Barcelona to Tarragona where she conquers the Catalonian mountains with her mountain bike. Kevin tries to beat her in Slovenia.

programme.title: Day 3
programme.desc: Kevin leaves civilization behind in Suriname, while thousands of kilometers away, Jalou has to go literally through the trees in an Australian forest.

programme.title: Delhi
programme.sub-title: S01 : E08 Running the World S1 - "Delhi"
programme.desc: Parkour athletes Max & Benj Cave head to Delhi India to complete a treacherous final run challenge.

programme.title: Mexico City
programme.sub-title: S01 : E09 Running the World S1 - "Mexico City"
programme.desc: Brothers Max & Benj Cave race through an 18th century monastery on the outskirts of Mexico City and whoever rings the bell in the tower first wins.

programme.title: Gran Canaria
programme.sub-title: S01 : E10 Running the World S1 - "Gran Canaria"
programme.desc: Brothers Max & Benj Cave are challenged to create a run through an abandoned water park on the island of Gran Canaria.

programme.title: Into the Bush
programme.sub-title: S01 : E13 The Armchair Adventurer S1 - "Into the Bush"
programme.desc: As Xander and his crew travel into the bush, they discover South Africa’s most beautiful qualities: national parks, safaris, and magnificent wildlife.

programme.title: The Lowveldt
programme.sub-title: S01 : E14 The Armchair Adventurer S1 - "The Lowveldt"
programme.desc: As Adam battles a wave of sadness, Xander and his team experience an African safari from the top of a horse, viewing spectacular wildlife and breathtaking savannahs.

programme.title: From Ohrigstad to Pilgrims Rest
programme.sub-title: S01 : E15 The Armchair Adventurer S1 - "From Ohrigstad to Pilgrims Rest"
programme.desc: From the Echo Caves of South Africa to the historical Pilgrims Rest, Xander begins to feel at home again in the location where he grew up.

programme.title: Lüderitz
programme.desc: Epic Exploring is going local again as Cody adventures in Lüderitz, Namibia going off the beaten path, through the desert and on to the ghost town of Pamona.

programme.title: Tokyo
programme.desc: Local Exploring in Tokyo is like nothing else. Josh and Lexi Limitless visit the crowded streets, a screaming Monster Café and an abandoned ‘Love Hotel’.

programme.title: Nikko
programme.desc: Epic Exploring: Going Local is back in Japan in Nikko as Cody, reunited with Sherman Mak, explores a derelict onsen and an amusement park called Western Village.

programme.title: Marriage Lows
programme.sub-title: S01 : E04 Love On The Rocks S1 - "Marriage Lows"
programme.desc: Jason experiences insecurity about challenges that the couple are, quite literally, dropped into. From falling out of the sky to a rappel into a dark cave, will the couple be able to work together or will they end up stranded in the dark?

programme.title: You Do What?
programme.sub-title: S01 : E05 Love On The Rocks S1 - "You Do What?"
programme.desc: The couple head to south western Oklahoma to climb at Quartz Mountain, but when Jason's confidence is shaken during a failed slab climb, Tayler realizes she may need to prepare to carry a larger load on their journey out west.

programme.title: Know Pain, Know Gain
programme.sub-title: S01 : E06 Love On The Rocks S1 - "Know Pain, Know Gain"
programme.desc: Failed rock climbing, failed training...struggling marriage? When everything seems to have gone wrong on their road trip in Oklahoma, Tayler and Jason are faced with the question..."are we biting off more than we can chew?" as they head to Wyoming.

programme.title: Inside Ferrari
programme.sub-title: S01 : E05 Car & Country Quest S1 - "Inside Ferrari"
programme.desc: The trio are joined by Mathias Lauda, son of F1 Legend Niki Lauda, at Ferrari’s Maranello HQ. From factory tours showcasing Ferrari’s craftsmanship to dining in Ferrari’s historic restaurant, the team immerses in Ferrari’s legacy.

programme.title: Inside Ferrari 2
programme.sub-title: S01 : E06 Car & Country Quest S1 - "Inside Ferrari 2"
programme.desc: Freddie leads an exclusive Ferrari tour, as they explore Ferrari’s design centre, visit its museum, and honour F1 champions. A friendly race in the Ferrari simulator and a scenic drive in new Ferraris close their Italian adventure beautifully.

programme.title: Naples
programme.sub-title: S01 : E01 Access All Areas S1 - "Naples"
programme.desc: Francesca Chiorando is on a quest to discover the truth behind the city of Naples, is it a kingdom of violence and a culture obsessed with death?

programme.title: Miao Silverware: A Shining Epic
programme.desc: In this episode, we explore the fascinating world of the silver-working art of the Miao ethnic group. Join us, and hear the stories and see the works of four remarkable individuals. From a national-level inheritor who is preserving the traditional craft, to an artist infusing personal flair into his designs; from a female silversmith imbuing her work with feminine warmth, to a young artisan inspiring a new generation, we investigate the rich heritage, cultural significance, and evolving potential of Miao silverware.

programme.title: Kungfu-wise: Pak Mei
programme.desc: In Foshan, China, Kleber seeks out Liu Weixin, a master of Pak Mei kungfu and on whom the hit game "Sifu" was based. He experiences for himself this style's relentless and lightning-fast strikes, but also learns from its master how to balance life and kungfu, how a master should treat his disciples, and what it means to "eat porridge at night"

programme.title: Kungfu-wise: Pak Mei
programme.desc: In Foshan, China, Kleber seeks out Liu Weixin, a master of Pak Mei kungfu and on whom the hit game "Sifu" was based. He experiences for himself this style's relentless and lightning-fast strikes, but also learns from its master how to balance life and kungfu, how a master should treat his disciples, and what it means to "eat porridge at night"

programme.title: Kungfu-wise: Hung Ga and Choy Li Fut
programme.desc: In Foshan, China, Kleber meets with two masters of southern Chinese martial arts. He learns from a Hung Ga master that while this kungfu style is often associated with brute force, it’s actually a combination of hard and soft techniques that can also be used in traditional Chinese massage. Next, Kleber meets a master of Choy Li Fut, a kungfu style that utilizes everyday items such as towels, fans and even abacuses, and discovers the link between martial arts and lion dance.

programme.title: Kungfu-wise: Hung Ga and Choy Li Fut
programme.desc: In Foshan, China, Kleber meets with two masters of southern Chinese martial arts. He learns from a Hung Ga master that while this kungfu style is often associated with brute force, it’s actually a combination of hard and soft techniques that can also be used in traditional Chinese massage. Next, Kleber meets a master of Choy Li Fut, a kungfu style that utilizes everyday items such as towels, fans and even abacuses, and discovers the link between martial arts and lion dance.

programme.title: Kungfu-wise: Hung Ga and Choy Li Fut
programme.desc: In Foshan, China, Kleber meets with two masters of southern Chinese martial arts. Next, Kleber meets a master of Choy Li Fut, a kungfu style that utilizes everyday items such as towels, fans and even abacuses, and discovers the link between martial arts and lion dance.

programme.title: Kungfu-wise: Taiji Quan
programme.desc: Kleber travels to Chenjiagou in central China, the birthplace of Chen-style Taiji Quan. Also known as tai chi, the martial art is iconic for its slow movements and purported health benefits, but Kleber quickly discovers it’s the real deal: From being thrown around by teenagers to learning about the martial art’s Yin-Yang philosophy, Kleber experiences for himself how this kungfu style allows small to defeat big, and soft to beat strong.

programme.title: Kungfu-wise: Taiji Quan
programme.desc: Kleber travels to Chenjiagou in central China, the birthplace of Chen-style Taiji Quan. Also known as tai chi, the martial art is iconic for its slow movements and purported health benefits, but Kleber quickly discovers it’s the real deal: From being thrown around by teenagers to learning about the martial art’s Yin-Yang philosophy, Kleber experiences for himself how this kungfu style allows small to defeat big, and soft to beat strong.

programme.title: Kungfu-wise: Five Ancestors Fist
programme.desc: In Quanzhou, southeast China, Kleber seeks out masters of the Five Ancestors Fist, a combination of five local kungfu styles. He meets the abbot of a Southern Shaolin Temple, and takes part in the extraordinary training regime used by Shaolin monks to hone their bodies and minds. He experiences the intricacies of Quanzhou’s traditional puppetry, and learns how Five Ancestors Fist incorporated military tactics that allowed its practitioners to band together and fight off pirates.

programme.title: Kungfu-wise: Five Ancestors Fist
programme.desc: In Quanzhou, southeast China, Kleber seeks out masters of the Five Ancestors Fist, a combination of five local kungfu styles. He meets the abbot of a Southern Shaolin Temple, and takes part in the extraordinary training regime used by Shaolin monks to hone their bodies and minds. He experiences the intricacies of Quanzhou’s traditional puppetry, and learns how Five Ancestors Fist incorporated military tactics that allowed its practitioners to band together and fight off pirates.

programme.title: Kungfu-wise: White Crane
programme.desc: In Yongchun, China, Kleber explores the origins of White Crane kungfu and its effect on the martial arts world. He learns how its blocks and strikes were inspired by animal movements, and how acupuncture points can be used to deadly effect. After training his grip and finger strength with wooden sticks, he travels to Beijing for an introduction to Goju-ryu karate, and discovers striking similarities with White Crane.

programme.title: Kungfu-wise: White Crane
programme.desc: In Yongchun, China, Kleber explores the origins of White Crane kungfu and its effect on the martial arts world. After training his grip and finger strength with wooden sticks, he travels to Beijing for an introduction to Goju-ryu karate, and discovers striking similarities with White Crane.

programme.title: Ding Porcelain Firing
programme.desc: In ancient times, skilled craftsmen combined clay with fire and, using nothing more than their hands and wisdom, created the history of porcelain.A thousand years ago, at the time of the Northern Song Dynasty, a type of porcelain was produced that stood out for its exquisite quality, elegant coloring and beautiful patterns. This was Ding porcelain, and it became a favorite at the imperial court. However, within 200 years, amid the chaos of constant warfare, the art of making it was lost. The dazzling white light of the Ding kilns had faded, seemingly forever. And yet, 800 years later, that light has been reignited.

programme.title: A Touch of Speed: The Art of Wing Chun
programme.desc: Uncover the principles of Wing Chun, a unique Chinese martial art renowned for its efficiency and directness. This program explores its legendary origins, core concepts like the center line theory, and its practical application in close-quarters combat. Witness the subtle power and intellectual depth of this sophisticated fighting system.

programme.title: A Touch of Speed: The Art of Wing Chun
programme.desc: Uncover the principles of Wing Chun, a unique Chinese martial art renowned for its efficiency and directness. This program explores its legendary origins, core concepts like the center line theory, and its practical application in close-quarters combat. Witness the subtle power and intellectual depth of this sophisticated fighting system.

programme.title: Quyang Stone Carving
programme.desc: Quyang is known as a hometown of Chinese carving. Quyang's stone carving works are popular around different parts of China, thus also exported to over 100 countries and regions worldwide. The style of Quyang stone carving both carries the mysterious and rough spirit of the Wei Dynasty and the natural and graceful forms of the Tang and Song dynasties. It reflects the life experiences and live philosophies of local artisans. Each statue's showcases unique oriental aesthetics.

programme.title: Quyang Stone Carving

programme.title: Grand Song of the Dong — Natural Oriental Harmony
programme.desc: The Grand Song of the Dong is a polyphonic folk singing tradition of the Dong ethnic group. Performers from several villages gather together to sing, unaccompanied.The songs, which describe the history, beliefs, customs, and emotions of the Dong people, are an important part of their cultural identity and contribute significantly to their social cohesion.Generally sung in the Dong language, which has no written form, they are passed on orally from one generation to the next. Classified into various genres—including narrative and love songs, drinking and funeral songs—they are often accompanied by clapping, stomping, and dancing.Sung on occasions such as festivals, weddings, and...

programme.title: Exploring Ethnic Attire: Dong Elegance
programme.desc: Dong clothing weaves together tradition, craftsmanship, and the unique identity of the Dong ethnic group. In this episode, we’ll unravel the stories behind the intricate designs, vibrant colors, and deep cultural significance of Dong attire. From ceremonial garments to everyday wear, each piece is imbued with the essence of a rich heritage.

programme.title: Kungfu-wise: Pak Mei
programme.desc: In Foshan, China, Kleber seeks out Liu Weixin, a master of Pak Mei kungfu and on whom the hit game "Sifu" was based. He experiences for himself this style's relentless and lightning-fast strikes, but also learns from its master how to balance life and kungfu, how a master should treat his disciples, and what it means to "eat porridge at night"

programme.title: Kungfu-wise: Pak Mei
programme.desc: In Foshan, China, Kleber seeks out Liu Weixin, a master of Pak Mei kungfu and on whom the hit game "Sifu" was based. He experiences for himself this style's relentless and lightning-fast strikes, but also learns from its master how to balance life and kungfu, how a master should treat his disciples, and what it means to "eat porridge at night"

programme.title: Kungfu-wise: Hung Ga and Choy Li Fut
programme.desc: In Foshan, China, Kleber meets with two masters of southern Chinese martial arts. He learns from a Hung Ga master that while this kungfu style is often associated with brute force, it’s actually a combination of hard and soft techniques that can also be used in traditional Chinese massage. Next, Kleber meets a master of Choy Li Fut, a kungfu style that utilizes everyday items such as towels, fans and even abacuses, and discovers the link between martial arts and lion dance.

programme.title: Kungfu-wise: Hung Ga and Choy Li Fut
programme.desc: In Foshan, China, Kleber meets with two masters of southern Chinese martial arts. He learns from a Hung Ga master that while this kungfu style is often associated with brute force, it’s actually a combination of hard and soft techniques that can also be used in traditional Chinese massage. Next, Kleber meets a master of Choy Li Fut, a kungfu style that utilizes everyday items such as towels, fans and even abacuses, and discovers the link between martial arts and lion dance.

programme.title: Kungfu-wise: Hung Ga and Choy Li Fut
programme.desc: In Foshan, China, Kleber meets with two masters of southern Chinese martial arts. He learns from a Hung Ga master that while this kungfu style is often associated with brute force, it’s actually a combination of hard and soft techniques that can also be used in traditional Chinese massage. Next, Kleber meets a master of Choy Li Fut, a kungfu style that utilizes everyday items such as towels, fans and even abacuses, and discovers the link between martial arts and lion dance.

programme.title: Kungfu-wise: Taiji Quan
programme.desc: Kleber travels to Chenjiagou in central China, the birthplace of Chen-style Taiji Quan. Also known as tai chi, the martial art is iconic for its slow movements and purported health benefits, but Kleber quickly discovers it’s the real deal: From being thrown around by teenagers to learning about the martial art’s Yin-Yang philosophy, Kleber experiences for himself how this kungfu style allows small to defeat big, and soft to beat strong.

programme.title: Kungfu-wise: Taiji Quan
programme.desc: Kleber travels to Chenjiagou in central China, the birthplace of Chen-style Taiji Quan. Also known as tai chi, the martial art is iconic for its slow movements and purported health benefits, but Kleber quickly discovers it’s the real deal: From being thrown around by teenagers to learning about the martial art’s Yin-Yang philosophy, Kleber experiences for himself how this kungfu style allows small to defeat big, and soft to beat strong.

programme.title: Kungfu-wise: Five Ancestors Fist
programme.desc: In Quanzhou, southeast China, Kleber seeks out masters of the Five Ancestors Fist, a combination of five local kungfu styles. He meets the abbot of a Southern Shaolin Temple, and takes part in the extraordinary training regime used by Shaolin monks to hone their bodies and minds. He experiences the intricacies of Quanzhou’s traditional puppetry, and learns how Five Ancestors Fist incorporated military tactics that allowed its practitioners to band together and fight off pirates.

programme.title: Kungfu-wise: Five Ancestors Fist
programme.desc: In Quanzhou, southeast China, Kleber seeks out masters of the Five Ancestors Fist, a combination of five local kungfu styles. He meets the abbot of a Southern Shaolin Temple, and takes part in the extraordinary training regime used by Shaolin monks to hone their bodies and minds. He experiences the intricacies of Quanzhou’s traditional puppetry, and learns how Five Ancestors Fist incorporated military tactics that allowed its practitioners to band together and fight off pirates.

programme.title: Kungfu-wise: White Crane
programme.desc: In Yongchun, China, Kleber explores the origins of White Crane kungfu and its effect on the martial arts world. He learns how its blocks and strikes were inspired by animal movements, and how acupuncture points can be used to deadly effect. After training his grip and finger strength with wooden sticks, he travels to Beijing for an introduction to Goju-ryu karate, and discovers striking similarities with White Crane.

programme.title: Kungfu-wise: White Crane
programme.desc: In Yongchun, China, Kleber explores the origins of White Crane kungfu and its effect on the martial arts world. He learns how its blocks and strikes were inspired by animal movements, and how acupuncture points can be used to deadly effect. After training his grip and finger strength with wooden sticks, he travels to Beijing for an introduction to Goju-ryu karate, and discovers striking similarities with White Crane.

programme.title: Ding Porcelain Firing
programme.desc: In ancient times, skilled craftsmen combined clay with fire and, using nothing more than their hands and wisdom, created the history of porcelain.A thousand years ago, at the time of the Northern Song Dynasty, a type of porcelain was produced that stood out for its exquisite quality, elegant coloring and beautiful patterns. This was Ding porcelain, and it became a favorite at the imperial court. However, within 200 years, amid the chaos of constant warfare, the art of making it was lost. The dazzling white light of the Ding kilns had faded, seemingly forever. And yet, 800 years later, that light has been reignited.

programme.title: Ding Porcelain Firing
programme.desc: In ancient times, skilled craftsmen combined clay with fire and, using nothing more than their hands and wisdom, created the history of porcelain.A thousand years ago, at the time of the Northern Song Dynasty, a type of porcelain was produced that stood out for its exquisite quality, elegant coloring and beautiful patterns. programme.title: Ding Porcelain Firing

programme.title: A Touch of Speed: The Art of Wing Chun
programme.desc: Uncover the principles of Wing Chun, a unique Chinese martial art renowned for its efficiency and directness. This program explores its legendary origins, core concepts like the center line theory, and its practical application in close-quarters combat. Witness the subtle power and intellectual depth of this sophisticated fighting system.

programme.title: A Touch of Speed: The Art of Wing Chun
programme.desc: Uncover the principles of Wing Chun, a unique Chinese martial art renowned for its efficiency and directness. This program explores its legendary origins, core concepts like the center line theory, and its practical application in close-quarters combat. Witness the subtle power and intellectual depth of this sophisticated fighting system.

programme.title: Quyang Stone Carving
programme.desc: Quyang is known as a hometown of Chinese carving. Quyang's stone carving works are popular around different parts of China, thus also exported to over 100 countries and regions worldwide. The style of Quyang stone carving both carries the mysterious and rough spirit of the Wei Dynasty and the natural and graceful forms of the Tang and Song dynasties. It reflects the life experiences and live philosophies of local artisans. Each statue's showcases unique oriental aesthetics.

programme.title: Quyang Stone Carving
programme.desc: Quyang is known as a hometown of Chinese carving. Quyang's stone carving works are popular around different parts of China, thus also exported to over 100 countries and regions worldwide. The style of Quyang stone carving both carries the mysterious and rough spirit of the Wei Dynasty and the natural and graceful forms of the Tang and Song dynasties. It reflects the life experiences and live philosophies of local artisans. Each statue's showcases unique oriental aesthetics.

programme.title: Grand Song of the Dong — Natural Oriental Harmony
programme.desc: The Grand Song of the Dong is a polyphonic folk singing tradition of the Dong ethnic group. Performers from several villages gather together to sing, unaccompanied.The songs, which describe the history, beliefs, customs, and emotions of the Dong people, are an important part of their cultural identity and contribute significantly to their social cohesion.Generally sung in the Dong language, which has no written form, they are passed on orally from one generation to the next. Classified into various genres—including narrative and love songs, drinking and funeral songs—they are often accompanied by clapping, stomping, and dancing.Sung on occasions such as festivals, weddings, and...

programme.title: Exploring Ethnic Attire: Dong Elegance
programme.desc: Dong clothing weaves together tradition, craftsmanship, and the unique identity of the Dong ethnic group. In this episode, we’ll unravel the stories behind the intricate designs, vibrant colors, and deep cultural significance of Dong attire. From ceremonial garments to everyday wear, each piece is imbued with the essence of a rich heritage.

programme.desc: Quyang is known as a hometown of Chinese carving. Quyang's stone carving works are popular around different parts of China, thus also exported to over 100 countries and regions worldwide. The style of Quyang stone carving both carries the mysterious and rough spirit of the Wei Dynasty and the natural and graceful forms of the Tang and Song dynasties. It reflects the life experiences and live philosophies of local artisans. Each statue's showcases unique oriental aesthetics.

programme.title: Grand Song of the Dong — Natural Oriental Harmony
programme.desc: The Grand Song of the Dong is a polyphonic folk singing tradition of the Dong ethnic group. Performers from several villages gather together to sing, unaccompanied.The songs, which describe the history, beliefs, customs, and emotions of the Dong people, are an important part of their cultural identity and contribute significantly to their social cohesion.Generally sung in the Dong language, which has no written form, they are passed on orally from one generation to the next. Classified into various genres—including narrative and love songs, drinking and funeral songs—they are often accompanied by clapping, stomping, and dancing.Sung on occasions such as festivals, weddings, and...

programme.title: Exploring Ethnic Attire: Dong Elegance
programme.desc: Dong clothing weaves together tradition, craftsmanship, and the unique identity of the Dong ethnic group. In this episode, we’ll unravel the stories behind the intricate designs, vibrant colors, and deep cultural significance of Dong attire. From ceremonial garments to everyday wear, each piece is imbued with the essence of a rich heritage.

programme.title: China Bound: Tianjin
programme.desc: Tianran He explores the vibrant port city of Tianjin. Strolling through its historic quarters, he discovers how old buildings are being preserved and revitalized, and savors the rich flavors of authentic Tianjin cuisine. To work off the calories, he joins energetic retirees for a morning workout in the park, then takes in the lively nightlife along the banks of the Haihe River. From folk handicrafts on Ancient Culture Street to the National Maritime Museum and an aircraft carrier theme park, Tianran discovers that Tianjin is a truly multifacted city.

programme.title: China Untapped: Nanjing 1
programme.desc: Nanjing, an ancient city that served as the capital of six imperial dynasties, stands as a testament to China's long-standing history and rich culture. From its Porcelain Tower - one of the Seven Wonders of the Middle Ages, to its grand city walls and ancient palaces, join us on a voyage across time to experience the echoes of history in Nanjing's storied bricks.

programme.title: China Untapped: Nanjing 2
programme.desc: In this episode, we explore the grand old mansions of Nanjing’s merchant families and take a stroll through their exquisite gardens, where Nature is incorporated into the architecture. From centuries-old Qing Dynasty residences to traditional folk handicrafts, join us on a deep dive into Nanjing’s rich cultural heritage.

programme.title: China Untapped: Nanjing 3
programme.desc: Join us in Nanjing’s bustling old quarter, where you can try on silk dresses worth their weight in gold, and see how traditional handicrafts have been given modern twists. We’ll feast on street snacks and local delicacies by the old Confucian Temple, before taking a pleasure cruise along Nanjing’s mother river to round off our exploration of this vibrant and historic city.

programme.title: China Untapped: Nanjing 3

programme.title: Life in Camel Town
programme.desc: When it comes to Mongolian, most people will think of grasslands, horse racing. In fact, the camel is the king of five livestock of nomadic people. Camel is the meritorious?figure in the vast desert on the Silk Road. In this episode, we go to Alashan: Camel Town in China, to experience the life of Mongolian people and camels in desert. Milking, delivering milk and collecting camels, also has a thrilling journey to pick up the newborn baby camel. We deeply feel the profound feeling between the camel raiser and their camels.

programme.title: Yangliuqing New Year Painting Art
programme.desc: On May 20, 2006, Yangliuqing New Year Paintings were named as part of China’s national intangible cultural heritage. The New Year painting tradition can be traced back many centuries, to the Ming Dynasty and beyond, reaching the height of its popularity in the Qing Dynasty. There are no restrictions on the themes of the paintings, and there is no blessing they cannot convey. Yangliuqing New Year Paintings are loved all over the country for their beautiful details and vivid colors—but most of all, for the good wishes they impart to anyone who sees them.

programme.title: The Tongliang Dragon Dance
programme.desc: The Tongliang Dragon Dance is a traditional performance art rooted in Chongqing’s Tongliang District, characterized by its elaborate dragon props and dynamic choreography. Originating in the Ming Dynasty and flourishing during the Qing, this vibrant folk tradition has regained its brilliance in modern times and earned international acclaim. The dance consists of two main branches: the dragon lantern dance—featuring forms like the Grand Wriggling Dragon, the Fire Dragon, and the Straw Dragon—and the festive lantern dance, which includes acts such as “Carp Leaps Over the Dragon Gate,” “Mudfish Eating Dumplings,” and “Three Dragons.” Steeped in cultural symbolism, the Tongliang Dragon Dance...

programme.title: The Tongliang Dragon Dance
programme.desc: The Tongliang Dragon Dance is a traditional performance art rooted in Chongqing’s Tongliang District, characterized by its elaborate dragon props and dynamic choreography. Originating in the Ming Dynasty and flourishing during the Qing, this vibrant folk tradition has regained its brilliance in modern times and earned international acclaim. The dance consists of two main branches: the dragon lantern dance—featuring forms like the Grand Wriggling Dragon, the Fire Dragon, and the Straw Dragon—and the festive lantern dance, which includes acts such as “Carp Leaps Over the Dragon Gate,” “Mudfish Eating Dumplings,” and “Three Dragons.” Steeped in cultural symbolism, the Tongliang Dragon Dance...

programme.title: From Stone to Story
programme.desc: China's profound stone carving culture dates back to the Han Dynasty (202 BC – 220 AD) and flourished during the Tang Dynasty (618 – 907 AD), evolving into a distinctive art form and unique cultural practice. Among many places famous for stone carving, Hui’an County—through generations of dedicated artisans—has risen to prominence and earned the esteemed title of "World Capital of Stone Carving," awarded by the World Crafts Council.The county’s skilled stonemasons are celebrated for their ability to transform ordinary pieces of rock into beautiful works of art. This episode shines a spotlight on the intangible cultural heritage of Hui’an stone carving and reveals how it has been...

programme.title: Suzhou Fans
programme.desc: Suzhou, known as the “Venice of China,” is also famous for its traditional crafts. And one of the most elegant and exquisite crafts is Suzhou fans. Celebrated for their exquisite design and fine quality, they’re popularly associated with literati. How come Suzhou gave birth to such a variety of fans? How can we appreciate their beauty in the modern world? In this episode, we are discovering more stories behind Suzhou fans.

programme.title: Suzhou Fans
programme.desc: Suzhou, known as the “Venice of China,” is also famous for its traditional crafts. And one of the most elegant and exquisite crafts is Suzhou fans. Celebrated for their exquisite design and fine quality, they’re popularly associated with literati. How come Suzhou gave birth to such a variety of fans? How can we appreciate their beauty in the modern world? In this episode, we are discovering more stories behind Suzhou fans.

programme.title: Four Faces of Muqam
programme.desc: Muqam is a performing art with its roots in the folklore of Xinjiang. Rather like an encyclopedia, Muqam is a record of the history and lifestyle of the local Uygur people. It originated in folk culture, with lyrics that covered everything from philosophical aphorisms to folk tales. Muqam is a vehicle for Uygur people to express their feelings and ideas. As such, it is an integral part of Xinjiang culture—and even the culture of the Silk Road.In the episode, the host travels around the Kashgar area, learning about the history and art of Muqam.

programme.title: The Elegance of Luoyang
programme.desc: Luoyang, as the eastern starting point of the Silk Road, is a city with a rich history and a tradition of cultural inclusivity. As such, it enjoys a prominent position in the heritage of the whole world.In this episode, we’ll visit White Horse Temple to learn about its fascinating international background. At Longmen Grottoes, which were designated as a UNESCO World Heritage Site in the year 2000, we’ll appreciate how the unique ancient splendor is being revived by 3D technology. At the city’s annual Peony Festival, we’ll explore the significance of China’s national flower and national dress.Invited to a Luoyang Water Banquet, we’ll learn something about the city’s culinary traditions....

From folk handicrafts on Ancient Culture Street to the National Maritime Museum and an aircraft carrier theme park, Tianran discovers that Tianjin is a truly multifacted city.

programme.desc: Nanjing, an ancient city that served as the capital of six imperial dynasties, stands as a testament to China's long-standing history and rich culture. From its Porcelain Tower - one of the Seven Wonders of the Middle Ages, to its grand city walls and ancient palaces, join us on a voyage across time to experience the echoes of history in Nanjing's storied bricks.

programme.title: China Untapped: Nanjing 3
programme.desc: Join us in Nanjing’s bustling old quarter, where you can try on silk dresses worth their weight in gold, and see how traditional handicrafts have been given modern twists. We’ll feast on street snacks and local delicacies by the old Confucian Temple, before taking a pleasure cruise along Nanjing’s mother river to round off our exploration of this vibrant and historic city.

programme.title: Life in Camel Town
programme.desc: When it comes to Mongolian, most people will think of grasslands, horse racing. In fact, the camel is the king of five livestock of nomadic people. Camel is the meritorious?figure in the vast desert on the Silk Road. In this episode, we go to Alashan: Camel Town in China, to experience the life of Mongolian people and camels in desert. Milking, delivering milk and collecting camels, also has a thrilling journey to pick up the newborn baby camel. We deeply feel the profound feeling between the camel raiser and their camels.

programme.title: Yangliuqing New Year Painting Art
programme.desc: On May 20, 2006, Yangliuqing New Year Paintings were named as part of China’s national intangible cultural heritage. The New Year painting tradition can be traced back many centuries, to the Ming Dynasty and beyond, reaching the height of its popularity in the Qing Dynasty. There are no restrictions on the themes of the paintings, and there is no blessing they cannot convey. Yangliuqing New Year Paintings are loved all over the country for their beautiful details and vivid colors—but most of all, for the good wishes they impart to anyone who sees them.

programme.title: The Tongliang Dragon Dance
programme.desc: The Tongliang Dragon Dance is a traditional performance art rooted in Chongqing’s Tongliang District, characterized by its elaborate dragon props and dynamic choreography. Originating in the Ming Dynasty and flourishing during the Qing, this vibrant folk tradition has regained its brilliance in modern times and earned international acclaim. The dance consists of two main branches: the dragon lantern dance—featuring forms like the Grand Wriggling Dragon, the Fire Dragon, and the Straw Dragon—and the festive lantern dance, which includes acts such as “Carp Leaps Over the Dragon Gate,” “Mudfish Eating Dumplings,” and “Three Dragons.” Steeped in cultural symbolism, the Tongliang Dragon Dance...

programme.title: The Tongliang Dragon Dance
programme.desc: The Tongliang Dragon Dance is a traditional performance art rooted in Chongqing’s Tongliang District, characterized by its elaborate dragon props and dynamic choreography. Originating in the Ming Dynasty and flourishing during the Qing, this vibrant folk tradition has regained its brilliance in modern times and earned international acclaim. The dance consists of two main branches: the dragon lantern dance—featuring forms like the Grand Wriggling Dragon, the Fire Dragon, and the Straw Dragon—and the festive lantern dance, which includes acts such as “Carp Leaps Over the Dragon Gate,” “Mudfish Eating Dumplings,” and “Three Dragons.” Steeped in cultural symbolism, the Tongliang Dragon Dance...

programme.title: From Stone to Story
programme.desc: China's profound stone carving culture dates back to the Han Dynasty (202 BC – 220 AD) and flourished during the Tang Dynasty (618 – 907 AD), evolving into a distinctive art form and unique cultural practice. Among many places famous for stone carving, Hui’an County—through generations of dedicated artisans—has risen to prominence and earned the esteemed title of "World Capital of Stone Carving," awarded by the World Crafts Council.The county’s skilled stonemasons are celebrated for their ability to transform ordinary pieces of rock into beautiful works of art. This episode shines a spotlight on the intangible cultural heritage of Hui’an stone carving and reveals how it has been...

programme.title: Suzhou Fans
programme.desc: Suzhou, known as the “Venice of China,” is also famous for its traditional crafts. And one of the most elegant and exquisite crafts is Suzhou fans. Celebrated for their exquisite design and fine quality, they’re popularly associated with literati. How come Suzhou gave birth to such a variety of fans? How can we appreciate their beauty in the modern world? In this episode, we are discovering more stories behind Suzhou fans.

programme.title: Suzhou Fans
programme.desc: Suzhou, known as the “Venice of China,” is also famous for its traditional crafts. And one of the most elegant and exquisite crafts is Suzhou fans. Celebrated for their exquisite design and fine quality, they’re popularly associated with literati. How come Suzhou gave birth to such a variety of fans? How can we appreciate their beauty in the modern world? In this episode, we are discovering more stories behind Suzhou fans.

programme.title: Four Faces of Muqam
programme.desc: Muqam is a performing art with its roots in the folklore of Xinjiang. Rather like an encyclopedia, Muqam is a record of the history and lifestyle of the local Uygur people. It originated in folk culture, with lyrics that covered everything from philosophical aphorisms to folk tales. Muqam is a vehicle for Uygur people to express their feelings and ideas. As such, it is an integral part of Xinjiang culture—and even the culture of the Silk Road.In the episode, the host travels around the Kashgar area, learning about the history and art of Muqam.

programme.title: The Elegance of Luoyang
programme.desc: Luoyang, as the eastern starting point of the Silk Road, is a city with a rich history and a tradition of cultural inclusivity. As such, it enjoys a prominent position in the heritage of the whole world.In this episode, we’ll visit White Horse Temple to learn about its fascinating international background. At Longmen Grottoes, which were designated as a UNESCO World Heritage Site in the year 2000, we’ll appreciate how the unique ancient splendor is being revived by 3D technology. At the city’s annual Peony Festival, we’ll explore the significance of China’s national flower and national dress.Invited to a Luoyang Water Banquet, we’ll learn something about the city’s culinary traditions....

programme.title: Nyingchi Ep.1
programme.desc: Join Tianran He in Nyingchi, Xizang Autonomous Region. Fed by the Yarlung Zangbo River and abundant rainfall, this lush subtropical region is home to some of Xizan’g most unique scenery. From sacred mountains and ancient monasteries, to cruising along Nyingchi’s mother river, wandering alpine meadows and savoring stone pot chicken – a beloved local delicacy, Tianran uncovers the beauty of Nyingchi.

programme.title: Nyingchi Ep.1

programme.title: Nyingchi Ep.2
programme.desc: In this episode, Tianran He continues his journey through Nyingchi, Xizang Autonomous Region. He meets the Lhoba people, China’s smallest ethnic group, who show him their traditional hunting attire. At a sacred lake, Tianran visits an ancient monastery and witnesses the 3000-year-old dance of the Gongbo Tibetans, before venturing to a remote village to experience their their way of life.

programme.title: Nyingchi Ep.2
programme.desc: In this episode, Tianran He continues his journey through Nyingchi, Xizang Autonomous Region. programme.title: Nyingchi Ep.2
programme.desc: In this episode, Tianran He continues his journey through Nyingchi, Xizang Autonomous Region. programme.title: Nyingchi Ep.3
programme.desc: In this episode, Tianran He rounds off his travels through Nyingchi, Xizang Autonomous Region. He journeys into the Yarlung Zangbo Grand Canyon – one of the largest and deepest canyons on Earth, and along the way, tries to catch a glimpse of Mount Namcha Barwa, the easternmost peak of the Himalayas. Instead, he encounters a waterfall said to be a gateway to the afterlife, before finally arriving at the entrance to the canyon.

programme.title: Nyingchi Ep.3
programme.desc: In this episode, Tianran He rounds off his travels through Nyingchi, Xizang Autonomous Region. He journeys into the Yarlung Zangbo Grand Canyon – one of the largest and deepest canyons on Earth, and along the way, tries to catch a glimpse of Mount Namcha Barwa, the easternmost peak of the Himalayas. Instead, he encounters a waterfall said to be a gateway to the afterlife, before finally arriving at the entrance to the canyon.

programme.title: Wenzhou
programme.desc: Tianran He is in Wenzhou, southeast China — a city famed for its self-made millionaires. Here he meets the first Chinese shoemaker to expand overseas, and hears the stories of other local entrepreneurs. Along the way, he samples traditional snacks, visits some of China’s oldest lighthouses, and enjoys an evening of Ou Opera. He also learns the craft of papermaking, before heading into the hills to soak in hot springs and wander across ancient covered bridges.

programme.title: Wenzhou
programme.desc: Tianran He is in Wenzhou, southeast China — a city famed for its self-made millionaires. Here he meets the first Chinese shoemaker to expand overseas, and hears the stories of other local entrepreneurs. Along the way, he samples traditional snacks, visits some of China’s oldest lighthouses, and enjoys an evening of Ou Opera. He also learns the craft of papermaking, before heading into the hills to soak in hot springs and wander across ancient covered bridges.

programme.title: Outkirts of Wenzhou
programme.desc: In this episode, Tianran He explores Wenzhou’s counties. From geological wonders and daring cliffside stunts at the Yandang Mountains, to rafting along the scenic Nanxi River, to harvesting seaweed and shellfish on the mud flats of the Dongtou Islands, Tianran discovers the ingenious ways the people of Wenzhou have transformed the challenges of living between mountains and seas into their greatest strengths.

programme.title: Rhythms of the Forest: A Sound of Li Instruments
programme.desc: Li bamboo and wood instruments offer a journey into the unique sounds of Hainan's Li ethnic group. Explore the ancient craftsmanship and musical heritage, from the resonant tones of bamboo flutes to the percussive rhythms of wooden drums. Experience the natural melodies that tell the stories of the Li people.

programme.title: World Heritages in Handan
programme.desc: Handan, a renowned historical and cultural city in China, boasts abundant cultural and tourism resources, including the Handan Museum and Congtai Park in Congtai District, as well as the Xiangtangshan Grottoes, Guangfu Ancient City, Cizhou Kiln, etc. Handan also has a long-standing connection with the Beijing-Hangzhou Grand Canal, a world cultural heritage. As a great project created in ancient China, the Grand Canal has not only exerted a profound impact on cities along the route in terms of transportation, economy and culture, but also served as an important driving force for Handan's development.

programme.title: A Touch of Speed: The Art of Wing Chun
programme.desc: Uncover the principles of Wing Chun, a unique Chinese martial art renowned for its efficiency and directness. This program explores its legendary origins, core concepts like the center line theory, and its practical application in close-quarters combat. Witness the subtle power and intellectual depth of this sophisticated fighting system.

programme.title: Diabolo
programme.desc: In China, the diabolo has a history of over 600 years. From the earliest uniaxial design, it developed to have a double axis. With time, it came to be made in various shapes and from various materials. And its popularity began to spread around the world. In the hands of an expert, a diabolo can create a truly mesmerizing spectacle. So, let’s hear from a professional about the various tricks of his trade.

programme.title: Quanzhou Nanyin: A Living Fossil in the History of Chinese Music
programme.desc: Nanyin, also known as “Quanzhou Nanyin,” is an ancient Han Chinese musical tradition whose singing style preserves the time-honored ethnic vocal techniques predating the Tang Dynasty, earning it the title of “a living fossil in the history of Chinese music.”The program features Yegor, a Ukrainian music enthusiast, visiting Master Su Shuyong, a Nanyin inheritor, to hear her decades-long stories of teaching this art. They also tour the Quanzhou Nanyin Troupe, where, led by its artistic director Zhuang Lifen, they learn about the basic performance formats and instruments of Nanyin. Additionally, the episode follows a post-1990s Nanyin performer, Zheng Mingming, as she sips tea with guests...

programme.title: Nyingchi Ep.1
programme.desc: Join Tianran He in Nyingchi, Xizang Autonomous Region. Fed by the Yarlung Zangbo River and abundant rainfall, this lush subtropical region is home to some of Xizan’g most unique scenery. From sacred mountains and ancient monasteries, to cruising along Nyingchi’s mother river, wandering alpine meadows and savoring stone pot chicken – a beloved local delicacy, Tianran uncovers the beauty of Nyingchi.

programme.title: Nyingchi Ep.2
programme.desc: In this episode, Tianran He continues his journey through Nyingchi, Xizang Autonomous Region. He meets the Lhoba people, China’s smallest ethnic group, who show him their traditional hunting attire. At a sacred lake, Tianran visits an ancient monastery and witnesses the 3000-year-old dance of the Gongbo Tibetans, before venturing to a remote village to experience their their way of life.

programme.title: Nyingchi Ep.3
programme.desc: In this episode, Tianran He rounds off his travels through Nyingchi, Xizang Autonomous Region. He journeys into the Yarlung Zangbo Grand Canyon – one of the largest and deepest canyons on Earth, and along the way, tries to catch a glimpse of Mount Namcha Barwa, the easternmost peak of the Himalayas. Instead, he encounters a waterfall said to be a gateway to the afterlife, before finally arriving at the entrance to the canyon.

programme.title: Cristina (Spain)
programme.sub-title: S01 : E01 My Zen People - Season 4 - Cristina (Spain)
programme.desc: At 31 years old, the last thing Cristina expected when she went to see the doctor about a blocked ear was to leave the consultation with a diagnosis for Breast Cancer. This young and passionate sociologist decided to apply the same philosophy to her treatment as she did when surfing: when a wave crashes down on you, get up and try again. Through her healing journey she deepened her love for the ocean and also discovered the therapeutic capabilities of yoga for cancer patients. Today she shares her practice through surf and yoga retreats and is specialised in oncological yoga, helping others heal.

programme.title: Idoia (Spain)
programme.sub-title: S01 : E01 My Zen People - Season 4 - Idoia (Spain)
programme.desc: Idoia thrives on weaving together the sources of inspiration that surround her. Heavily influenced by the natural beauty of her home region of Galicia, Spain, she creates unique woven pieces from diverse and beautiful materials. Idoia’s pieces represent her vision of a modern woman, drawing from the traditions and experiences of those who perfected the craft before her and also pushing to innovate and adapt her creations for the modern world. Her recent collaboration with luxury fashion house Loewe is a dream come true for this modern artisan.

programme.desc: With Bangladesh as a running thread, Yann Arthus-Bertrand meets several people who have changed their lives to dedicate themselves to a major project. In Bangladesh, Yves and Runa Marre have created the Friendship Foundation. Among other things, they’ve created a floating hospital installed on an old barge bought in France. Julie Andersen, an ex-advertising executive from New York has come to South Africa to defend sharks with her Shark Angels Foundation. In North India, Kartik Satyanarayan is helping to stop the dreadful exploitation of the lippus bears (dancing bears). He’s created Wildlife SOS, a preserve to rehabilitate the bears that have been rescued and to give work to the men of...

programme.title: USA: The end of oil - Part 1
programme.sub-title: S01 : E01 Earth from above - Season 3 - USA: The end of oil - Part 1
programme.desc: "The end of oil" is the amazing story of a raw material which has revolutionized man's life in just a century. But today, oil reserves are depleting. In his crazy race for always more production, Man didn't manage to preserve this precious energy that took million years for the Earth to give out. To tell the adventure of oil, Yann Arthus-Bertrand and his team went to the United States, the country which depends the most on black gold. At the start of the 21st century, it is now urgent to realize that oil resources are limited. It's today that we have to act and get organized, in order to prepare the new era to come. While all our economies are based on the petrol barrel's price, we'll...

programme.title: A la carte grills
programme.sub-title: S01 : E01 Julie's Frenchy Cookbook - Season 4 - A la carte grills
programme.desc: If you're a nature enthusiast and a fan of outdoor cooking, the upcoming season is perfect for barbecue enthusiasts! Our journey will take us to Aube, nestled in the heart of the Brévonnes forest, and then to the Massif des Bauges, where grilling and snow create a unique combination. Afterward, we'll explore the Libournais region, where we'll uncover cooking techniques that make use of vine shoots, which are plentiful in the area. Just a short distance from the vineyards, we'll arrive at another corner of Gironde, the Blaye region, where the cooking method remains consistent but features a distinctly local ingredient: eel.

programme.sub-title: S01 : E01 My Zen Trendy - Season 1 - Cryotherapy & Vinyasa Yoga
programme.desc: It's in an episode full of surprise that we meet with Val Khal in the heart of Los Angeles for a visit to the new trendy wellbeing boutique Springs. This new concept store offers the opportunity to make Vinyasa yoga wearing a trendy outfit, treat yourself to a revitalizing juice detox before heading to a Cryotherapy session without leaving the venue! For a relaxing time after an intensive Vinyasa yoga session, Val takes you to a session of Fire cupping where the heath is ideal for getting rid of muscular pains from day-to-day stress.

programme.title: Acro Yoga on a Skyscraper
programme.sub-title: S01 : E01 My Zen Trendy - Season 2 - Acro Yoga on a Skyscraper
programme.desc: Val takes us to Los Angeles, on the roof of one of the most prestigious hotels in Beverly Hills for a session of acro yoga, aerial acrobatic yoga. Then, in the heart of Downtown, Val will experience a glass slide down one of the tallest towers in California. She'll also try SandBox Fitness, the trendy indoor surfing class, before trying Lazerfit, a new way to work out that combines warm-up, stretching and laser tag.

Come on, let's see how they have grown.

programme.sub-title: S01 : E01 Origami - Season 1 - The Iris flower

We will teach you how to transform a flat square sheet of paper into a finished sculpture – from simple to complex!

programme.title: Everything is living and everything is linked - Part 2
programme.sub-title: S01 : E01 Earth from above - Season 1 - Everything is living and everything is linked - Part 2
programme.desc: Through the most magnificent images and amazing human stories, Man is at the heart of the biodiversity that he must respect and preserve. We go to China in the province of Yunan, where a plant with exceptional virtues against malaria has been discovered. Then we travel to Africa, where man's intervention in the ecosystem of Lake Victoria has triggered a considerable imbalance. We will also explore to Greenland to meet the polar bears, the first victims of the melting ice.

programme.title: Sweets on the menu
programme.sub-title: S01 : E01 Julie's Frenchy Cookbook - Season 4 - Sweets on the menu
programme.desc: Today, Julie takes us down a different kind of yellow-brick road, one that tastes of childhood and gourmet delights: the road of sweets. France may be famous for its gastronomy, but it's not to be outdone when it comes to pastries and confectionery - quite the opposite. “Bêtises” from Cambrai, "Berlingots” from Carpentras, "Calissons” from Aix-en-provence, every region in France has its own sweet or confectionery.

programme.title: Acrobatic Yoga

She then attends a perilous acrobatic yoga class with Vibe Yoga where her sense of balance has been challenged a few times. 'Believe or leave!' This is Bol Meditation’s motto where Val discovers the benefits of Intense meditation on our body and mind. All together, this place is a piece of heaven in the middle of ettic L.A.

programme.title: Melliferous plants

programme.desc: Let's get together to continue discovering new plants together. Look at all these flowers, they are honey plants. But what are honey plants? Doesn't that make you think of another word? The word honey? Yes, because honey plants are plants that attract insects, and in particular bees, which feed on these flowers to make honey.

programme.title: Destination Sardinia
programme.sub-title: S01 : E01 The Blue Zones of Longevity - Season 1 - Destination Sardinia
programme.desc: The first stop on this journey to the land of happy, long life is the Ogliastra region of Sardinia. Here, almost one in five inhabitants is over 90 - 20 times more than in France! Yet this is a far cry from the Mediterranean diet recommended by nutritionists: meat and cholesterol galore. Even more astonishing, consanguinity is paradoxically conducive to the extreme longevity of the inhabitants... our wellness food specialist and a general practitioner will investigate these phenomena and meet nonagenarians and centenarians with exceptional stories.

programme.title: Everything is living and everything is linked - Part 1
programme.sub-title: S01 : E01 Earth from above - Season 1 - Everything is living and everything is linked - Part 1
programme.desc: Through the most magnificent images and astonishing human stories, Man is at the heart of the biodiversity that he must respect and preserve. We find ourselves in Kenya, where the biodiversity is particularly rich, in the Massaï Mara reserve. Then, in the Democratic Republic of Congo, where the worrying disappearance of hippos from Lake Edward has unexpected consequences for the survival of fishermen. Then, in the sanctuary of life, the Pantanal region in Brazil, where millions of animal and plant species are teeming, some of the world's great wetlands also in danger. In Tasmania, Yann Arthus-Bertrand fights against the napalm deforestation of one of the oldest and most beautiful forests...

programme.title: The flavors of flowers
programme.sub-title: S01 : E01 Julie's Frenchy Cookbook - Season 4 - The flavors of flowers
programme.desc: Eating flowers might appear unconventional, but we often consume them without even realizing it. Consider artichokes, for instance : they are essentially large, unopened flowers. Capers are the preserved buds of flowers soaked in vinegar, and cloves are dried flower buds. We also find courgette flowers, saffron pistils, orange blossom water used to flavor pastries, and the violet sweets that evoke memories of our childhood. In addition to adding aesthetic appeal and providing a dose of vitamins to our plates, flowers elevate the flavors of a dish and can even serve as a vegetable substitute.

programme.title: Escape

programme.title: Hot Yoga Session
programme.sub-title: S01 : E01 My Zen Trendy - Season 1 - Hot Yoga Session
programme.desc: Always on the look for looking for new detox discoveries, Val leads us to Lifehouse’s tonic and elixirs. Here, she discovers the range of elixir with therapeutic virtues exhilarating and relaxing. Before leaving, we made a hook by Jack's lab to prepare our own elixir. A private hot Yoga session then awaited Val at the popular Urban Exhale Hot Yoga where wearing a swimsuit could be welcomed. This episode ends on a fruity note as we tasted smoothies with unusual names that seduced Val, especially the 72 and Sun.

programme.title: Zero Gravity Bath with Sinclair
programme.sub-title: S01 : E01 My Zen Trendy - Season 2 - Zero Gravity Bath with Sinclair
programme.desc: Val gives an appointment to the singer Sinclair, for a floating session: a sensory deprivation technique in a bath. Then, we will discover an experience that is all the rage across the Atlantic, the Barre Shape! It's a class that mixes classical dance, yoga and cardio training. All this in a girly and boudoir atmosphere. After the effort comes comfort! We will meet a Superfood expert who will make us test and discover all the "Superfoods" that are very popular in California and that the whole healthy world is talking about.

programme.title: Collecting seeds
programme.sub-title: S01 : E01 My First Garden - Season 1 - Collecting seeds
programme.desc: We meet in the market garden of Romainville to learn how to save seeds. As you may have noticed, fruits, such as apples and lemons, contain seeds, but so do some of the vegetables you eat, such as peppers and tomatoes. This is because they are, in fact, fruits just like the apple and the lemon. They come from a flower and therefore contain seeds.

programme.title: Destination Okinawa
programme.sub-title: S01 : E01 The Blue Zones of Longevity - Season 1 - Destination Okinawa
programme.desc: Genetic, biological, cultural and dietary factors combine to make the Japanese island of Okinawa a zone of extreme longevity. Why is it that cancer is virtually non-existent here? We'll see that the famous Japanese trio of "rice, fish and soy" is not the key to longevity, but a diet based on plants, lots of green leafy vegetables and endemic sweet potatoes. Self-restriction and strong social ties are other elements that our naturopathic chef and attending physician will discover on site, together with local inhabitants and scientists.

programme.title: USA: The end of oil - Part 2
programme.sub-title: S01 : E01 Earth from above - Season 3 - USA: The end of oil - Part 2
programme.desc: "The end of oil" is the amazing story of a raw material which has revolutionized man's life in just a century. But today, oil reserves are depleting. In his crazy race for always more production, Man didn't manage to preserve this precious energy that took million years for the Earth to give out. To tell the adventure of oil, Yann Arthus-Bertrand and his team went to the United States, the country which depends the most on black gold. At the start of the 21st century, it is now urgent to realize that oil resources are limited. It's today that we have to act and get organized, in order to prepare the new era to come. While all our economies are based on the petrol barrel's price, we'll...
